generif.text: Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

These results identify a key post-translational mechanism that controls progesterone receptor protein levels and for the first time provide an important insight into the function of CUEDC2 in breast cancer proliferation.
key factor in endocrine resistance in breast cancer
CUEDC2 is a cell-cycle regulator that promotes spindle checkpoint inactivation and releases APC/C from checkpoint inhibition. CUEDC2 is phosphorylated by Cdk1 during mitosis.
a new biological activity for CUEDC2 as the regulator of JAK1/STAT3 signaling and the mechanism by which SOCS3 has been linked to suppression of the JAK/STAT pathway

In response to UV irradiation, CUEDC2 undergoes ERK1/2-dependent phosphorylation and ubiquitin-dependent degradation, leading to APC/C(Cdh1)-mediated cyclin A destruction, cyclin-dependent kinase 2 inactivation, and G1 arrest.
High CUEDC2 sensitizes chronic myeloid leukemic cells to imatinib treatment.
CUEDC2 plays a crucial role in modulating macrophage function and is associated with both colitis and colon tumorigenesis.
Results suggest that decreased expression of CUEDC2 contributes to tumor growth in lung adenocarcinoma, leading to a poor clinical outcome.

findings show a correlation between the aberrant expression of CUEDC2, and GLUT3 and LDHA in clinical hepatocellular carcinoma samples, further demonstrating a link between CUEDC2 and the Warburg effect during cancer development
Low CUEDC2 expression is associated with glioma.

the present study demonstrated that CUEDC2 downregulation prevented DOXinduced cardiotoxicity in H9c2 cells. Therefore, CUEDC2 may be a promising target for the prevention of DOXinduced cardiotoxicity.
CUEDC2, a novel interacting partner of the SOCS1 protein, plays important roles in the leukaemogenesis of acute myeloid leukaemia
MicroRNA hsa-miR-324-5p suppresses H5N1 virus replication by targeting the viral PB1 and host CUEDC2.
High Expression of CUEDC2 is associated with invasion and metastasis in colorectal cancer.
review of CUEDC2 expression in various tumors, and discussion of several fundamental signaling pathways that are impacted by CUEDC2 [review]
Kawasaki disease: SOCS2-AS1/miR-324-5p/CUEDC2 axis regulates the progression of human umbilical vein endothelial cells.
Comparison of ADAM19 and CUEDC2 expression in EHCC and their clinicopathological significance.
Expression of CUE domain containing 2 protein in serous ovarian cancer tissue: predicting disease-free and overall survival of patients.
LncRNA BCYRN1 inhibits glioma tumorigenesis by competitively binding with miR-619-5p to regulate CUEDC2 expression and the PTEN/AKT/p21 pathway.
MicroRNA-324-5p-CUEDC2 Axis Mediates Gain-of-Function Mutant p53-Driven Cancer Stemness.
Molecular crosstalk between CUEDC2 and ERalpha influences the clinical outcome by regulating mitosis in breast cancer.

BP.term: negative regulation of macrophage cytokine production
negative regulation of cytokine production involved in inflammatory response

name: CUE domain containing 2

wikipathways.name: Regulation of toll-like receptor signaling pathway

summary: Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Acts upstream of or within negative regulation of cytokine production involved in inflammatory response and negative regulation of macrophage cytokine production. Located in cytosol; nuclear membrane; and nucleoplasm. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
